urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@timthefruit @Feargal_Sharkey @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot Potentially irreparable damage to a SSSI, with direct and significant impacts on an SAC, in full public view? The prosecution needs to be just as visible.

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

Guardian: @EnvAgency slashes number of water pollution incident visits amid rising fears water industry is now polluting UK rivers with impunity putting the health of river users and unique ecosystems at risk https://t.co/FbjqetyRzY via @Feargal_Sharkey @bilgribs

Terrible to hear about this eco-vandalism at #RiverLuggSSSI in #Herefordshire

It's a clear breach of environmental legislation, and test case for @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency enforcement

We @WildlifeTrusts will be following it very carefully https://t.co/YZpRTggpl4

tweets.text: @Blacky_Himself @Nickhod53168394 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency it's not clear why they weren't allowed out... today the EA told me they are classed as key workers ... so they should have been able to do their jobs...

@timthefruit @Blacky_Himself @MilesKing10 @GeorgeMonbiot I will be delighted for you to tell me I‚Äôm wrong but the EA has form when it comes the SSSIs being destroyed and then doing nothing.

https://t.co/ZlmSTfLcb7
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @bilgribs Bloody useless, the sale of rod licences has sky rocketed during lockdown, a massive boost in there revenue.

@RobGMacfarlane @silverpebble @EnvAgency Any potential fine was no doubt factored into the plan...they'll pay, if charged, eventually, wait a few years, and initiate whatever plan they had. Fines and complete restoration at their cost is the only real punishment for such wilful destruction.

Now that we‚Äôve left the EU, new rules for exporting food start 01 Jan 2021

This is how @DewlayCheese are preparing. Find out the steps you need to take

üëâüèº https://t.co/DnD3c4IzPi  
#BrexitTransition #SmallBizSatUK https://t.co/T1BijwMhKd

Catastrophic damage to River Lugg SSSI as river banks bulldozed & reprofiled and all bankside & riverside habitats obliterated. This has destroyed wildlife habitat, will increase flood risk downstream, allow soil and pollution to run into the river  We need #30by30 #WilderFuture https://t.co/Q6wS3Ir44f
@RobGMacfarlane @StuartMaconie @EnvAgency Excuse my ignorance , what‚Äôs an SSSI ?. How is it possible they can do that ?.
We're proud to support @N_Rivers_Trust as partners in this project to help improve the water quality of an important Norfolk chalk stream. üëç https://t.co/Kd0iE4krWf

I‚Äôm conscious this is the second serious incident in Avonmouth in as many weeks. Once our emergency services have resolved this incident and helped any injured workers, I‚Äôll be calling on the @EnvAgency @H_S_E and others to ensure lessons are being learnt for the future.

tweets.text: @RobGMacfarlane @StuartMaconie @EnvAgency At this time of year, when salmon and trout are spawning, and heavier rainfall will just wash all that soil into the river,  it's just despicable, made worse by the fact we cannot rely on the EA to respond adequately.
